Respectfully, SUNLINER81 Read his article and try and dispute what he has to say now, during the election campaign, and even before. In spite of every attempt to paint him an extremist left wing villain (even by George Bush personally, John McCain, and by the entire Republican spin machine) he prevailed and has won. Damn near everything Barack Obama was elected for, he stood for, and is being done by the President. The best part of the article was the Michigan Democrat who asked that he (Moore) endorse him for election to congress, unseating a Republican encumbent, Moore did, and the Republican's jumped all over it with a vengeance, thinking his endorsement was the kiss of death for the Democratic candidate, then showing Moore and the candidate together in TV commercials, hell, the Republicans truly believed Moore's endorsement was the candidates demise. Until after the election, the Democrat beat the Republican incumbent. So much for "the people" hating Michael Moore enough to bury his endorsee in humiliating defeat. "I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies." - T. Jefferson

content: I'm not a big fan of Moore, not because I disagree with his politics, but because I don't like to praise those who mess around with the facts. Moore should be ashamed of fudging the facts, especially since the absolute truth is so much better. But it is true that the Republican campaign to integrally link him to the Democrats simply didn't hurt the Democrats, whereas the Democratic campaign to link Limbaugh to the Republicans has been a dramatic success. In the one case, the Republican campaign was simply ignored and just wilted, whereas thanks to Rush and the Republican leadership, more and more people are starting to see him as the face of the Republican Party - And that's going to hurt. Strangely enough the Democrats had more success LYING about Nader (my candidate) as a Republican stalking horse, and they benefited from these lies. Dave
reply: I'm not a big fan of Moore, not because I disagree with his politics, but because I don't like to praise those who mess around with the facts. Moore should be ashamed of fudging the facts, especially since the absolute truth is so much better. But it is true that the Republican campaign to integrally link him to the Democrats simply didn't hurt the Democrats, whereas the Democratic campaign to link Limbaugh to the Republicans has been a dramatic success. In the one case, the Republican campaign was simply ignored and just wilted, whereas thanks to Rush and the Republican leadership, more and more people are starting to see him as the face of the Republican Party - And that's going to hurt. Strangely enough the Democrats had more success LYING about Nader (my candidate) as a Republican stalking horse, and they benefited from these lies. Dave
title: Why I (Michael Moore) Am Not Now and Have Never Been the Democrats' "Rush Limbaugh"

content: quote: Originally posted by Grachus: I'm not a big fan of Moore, not because I disagree with his politics, but because I don't like to praise those who mess around with the facts. Moore should be ashamed of fudging the facts, especially since the absolute truth is so much better. The premise of his "documentary" Roger and Me was that then GM president Roger Smith would not do an on camera interview to explain employee layoffs and plant closures. It turns out Smith did do at least one interview but Moore kept it out of his film. Don't mince words. The man is a lier. But it is true that the Republican campaign to integrally link him to the Democrats simply didn't hurt the Democrats, whereas the Democratic campaign to link Limbaugh to the Republicans has been a dramatic success. Baloney. The problem is that the GOP does not have a strong leader. In the one case, the Republican campaign was simply ignored and just wilted, whereas thanks to Rush and the Republican leadership, more and more people are starting to see him as the face of the Republican Party - And that's going to hurt. Rush has come out and insisted he is not the head of the GOP. Strangely enough the Democrats had more success LYING about Nader (my candidate) as a Republican stalking horse, and they benefited from these lies. I wonder what lies the Democrats told about Mr. Nader. Ralph Nader has a long history of fudging the facts going back to his auto safety work Unsafe at any Speed and VW; Small on Safety. In any election, this man does not have enough support to get himlelf elected but did have enough of a following ammong Democratic voters to get the Republican candidate voted in. On the other hand, Bill Clinton owes Ross Perot a debt of gratitude for his 1992 victory. Dave
quote: Originally posted by Grachus: I'm not a big fan of Moore, not because I disagree with his politics, but because I don't like to praise those who mess around with the facts. Moore should be ashamed of fudging the facts, especially since the absolute truth is so much better. The premise of his "documentary" Roger and Me was that then GM president Roger Smith would not do an on camera interview to explain employee layoffs and plant closures. It turns out Smith did do at least one interview but Moore kept it out of his film. Don't mince words. The man is a lier. But it is true that the Republican campaign to integrally link him to the Democrats simply didn't hurt the Democrats, whereas the Democratic campaign to link Limbaugh to the Republicans has been a dramatic success. Baloney. The problem is that the GOP does not have a strong leader. In the one case, the Republican campaign was simply ignored and just wilted, whereas thanks to Rush and the Republican leadership, more and more people are starting to see him as the face of the Republican Party - And that's going to hurt. Rush has come out and insisted he is not the head of the GOP. Strangely enough the Democrats had more success LYING about Nader (my candidate) as a Republican stalking horse, and they benefited from these lies. I wonder what lies the Democrats told about Mr. Nader. Ralph Nader has a long history of fudging the facts going back to his auto safety work Unsafe at any Speed and VW; Small on Safety. In any election, this man does not have enough support to get himlelf elected but did have enough of a following ammong Democratic voters to get the Republican candidate voted in. On the other hand, Bill Clinton owes Ross Perot a debt of gratitude for his 1992 victory. Dave
title: Why I (Michael Moore) Am Not Now and Have Never Been the Democrats' "Rush Limbaugh"

content: I'm not a big fan of Moore, not because I disagree with his politics, but because I don't like to praise those who mess around with the facts. Moore should be ashamed of fudging the facts, especially since the absolute truth is so much better. But it is true that the Republican campaign to integrally link him to the Democrats simply didn't hurt the Democrats, whereas the Democratic campaign to link Limbaugh to the Republicans has been a dramatic success. In the one case, the Republican campaign was simply ignored and just wilted, whereas thanks to Rush and the Republican leadership, more and more people are starting to see him as the face of the Republican Party - And that's going to hurt. Strangely enough the Democrats had more success LYING about Nader (my candidate) as a Republican stalking horse, and they benefited from these lies. Dave
reply: I'm not a big fan of Moore, not because I disagree with his politics, but because I don't like to praise those who mess around with the facts. Moore should be ashamed of fudging the facts, especially since the absolute truth is so much better. But it is true that the Republican campaign to integrally link him to the Democrats simply didn't hurt the Democrats, whereas the Democratic campaign to link Limbaugh to the Republicans has been a dramatic success. In the one case, the Republican campaign was simply ignored and just wilted, whereas thanks to Rush and the Republican leadership, more and more people are starting to see him as the face of the Republican Party - And that's going to hurt. Strangely enough the Democrats had more success LYING about Nader (my candidate) as a Republican stalking horse, and they benefited from these lies. Dave
title: Why I (Michael Moore) Am Not Now and Have Never Been the Democrats' "Rush Limbaugh"

content: quote: Originally posted by Grachus: I'm not a big fan of Moore, not because I disagree with his politics, but because I don't like to praise those who mess around with the facts. Moore should be ashamed of fudging the facts, especially since the absolute truth is so much better. The premise of his "documentary" Roger and Me was that then GM president Roger Smith would not do an on camera interview to explain employee layoffs and plant closures. It turns out Smith did do at least one interview but Moore kept it out of his film. Don't mince words. The man is a lier. But it is true that the Republican campaign to integrally link him to the Democrats simply didn't hurt the Democrats, whereas the Democratic campaign to link Limbaugh to the Republicans has been a dramatic success. Baloney. The problem is that the GOP does not have a strong leader. In the one case, the Republican campaign was simply ignored and just wilted, whereas thanks to Rush and the Republican leadership, more and more people are starting to see him as the face of the Republican Party - And that's going to hurt. Rush has come out and insisted he is not the head of the GOP. Strangely enough the Democrats had more success LYING about Nader (my candidate) as a Republican stalking horse, and they benefited from these lies. I wonder what lies the Democrats told about Mr. Nader. Ralph Nader has a long history of fudging the facts going back to his auto safety work Unsafe at any Speed and VW; Small on Safety. In any election, this man does not have enough support to get himlelf elected but did have enough of a following ammong Democratic voters to get the Republican candidate voted in. On the other hand, Bill Clinton owes Ross Perot a debt of gratitude for his 1992 victory. Dave
quote: Originally posted by Grachus: I'm not a big fan of Moore, not because I disagree with his politics, but because I don't like to praise those who mess around with the facts. Moore should be ashamed of fudging the facts, especially since the absolute truth is so much better. The premise of his "documentary" Roger and Me was that then GM president Roger Smith would not do an on camera interview to explain employee layoffs and plant closures. It turns out Smith did do at least one interview but Moore kept it out of his film. Don't mince words. The man is a lier. But it is true that the Republican campaign to integrally link him to the Democrats simply didn't hurt the Democrats, whereas the Democratic campaign to link Limbaugh to the Republicans has been a dramatic success. Baloney. The problem is that the GOP does not have a strong leader. In the one case, the Republican campaign was simply ignored and just wilted, whereas thanks to Rush and the Republican leadership, more and more people are starting to see him as the face of the Republican Party - And that's going to hurt. Rush has come out and insisted he is not the head of the GOP. Strangely enough the Democrats had more success LYING about Nader (my candidate) as a Republican stalking horse, and they benefited from these lies. I wonder what lies the Democrats told about Mr. Nader. Ralph Nader has a long history of fudging the facts going back to his auto safety work Unsafe at any Speed and VW; Small on Safety. In any election, this man does not have enough support to get himlelf elected but did have enough of a following ammong Democratic voters to get the Republican candidate voted in. On the other hand, Bill Clinton owes Ross Perot a debt of gratitude for his 1992 victory. Dave
title: Why I (Michael Moore) Am Not Now and Have Never Been the Democrats' "Rush Limbaugh"
